channel.title: gi stardust
channel.description: Here are the building blocks to a successful front-end development world.

item.title: Welcome to Jekyll!
item.description:
You’ll find this post in your _posts directory. Go ahead and edit it and re-build the site to see your changes. You can rebuild the site in many different ways, but the most common way is to run jekyll serve, which launches a web server and auto-regenerates your site when a file is updated.

To add new posts, simply add a file in the _posts directory that follows the convention YYYY-MM-DD-name-of-post.ext and includes the necessary front matter. Take a look at the source for this post to get an idea about how it works.

Jekyll also offers powerful support for code snippets:

def print_hi(name)
  puts "Hi, #{name}"
end
print_hi('Tom')
#=> prints 'Hi, Tom' to STDOUT.

Check out the Jekyll docs for more info on how to get the most out of Jekyll. File all bugs/feature requests at Jekyll’s GitHub repo. If you have questions, you can ask them on Jekyll’s dedicated Help repository.

item.title: Stop Your Server: (3/3)
item.description:
Let's stop your server

If you haven't built your workspace already, start with Build Your Workspace: (1/3)

If you haven't learned to start your server, go to Start Your Server: (2/3)

  1. /Users/leong_e/Software/apache-tomcat-7.0.55/bin/./catalina.sh stop Use shortcut "control + r" + type stop
  2. Check to see if your server is stopped ps ux | grep 'tomcat'.

    You should only see one line of code on top of the command.

  3. If the server has more than 1 line, it's still running, you must kill ^_^
  4. Get your process ID
  5. kill -9 28643
  6. code>ps ux | grep 'tomcat'
  7. boom. success.

item.title: Start Your Server: (2/3)
item.description:
Let's start your server

If you haven't built your workspace already, start with Build Your Workspace: (1/3)

  1. Set your .profile
  2. git pull
  3. Build your projects in a specific order
    1. shared-platform - run for the first time in ghix-platform/setup/dependencies: .install-maven-dep.sh
    2. shared-models
    3. [your project]
  4. mvn clean install -DskipTests "control + r" - start typing and it will finish it for you
  5. Change your configuration.properites to npoint to the correct database. Save a local version of a configuration.properties to save time.
  6. Go to where your deploymentScript.sh lives
  7. Run ./deploymentScript.sh
  8. Yippee! Your server has started!

How do you see local changes?

  1. cd to where your tomcat is /Users/leong_e/Software/apache-tomcat-7.0.55/webapps
  2. Get the path for your file.
  3. cp <FILEPATH> hix/<FILEPATH>

Next - Stop Your Server: (3/3)

item.title: Build Your Workspace: (1/3)
item.description:
Here are deployment steps to set up your workspace like the smart engineers do.

Build Your Workspace: You only need to do this ONCE

If you've done this already, skip to Start Server

  1. Download tomcat (Core: zip or tar.gz)
  2. Download maven
  3. Put both folders into your Software folder
  4. Create .profile and change the specific paths 
    M2_HOME=/Users/leong_e/Software/apache-maven-3.2.2
export M2_HOME
export M2=$M2_HOME/bin
export PATH=$M2:$PATH

# maven options
export MAVEN_OPTS="-Xmx1624m -XX:MaxPermSize=1624m"
export JAVA_HOME=/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_60.jdk/Contents/Home
export PATH=$PATH:$JAVA_HOME/bin

export GHIX_HOME="/Users/leong_e/Documents/Workfolder/beta/ghix"
export PASSWORD_KEY=ghix123
export CATALINA_HOME="/Users/leong_e/Software/apache-tomcat-7.0.55"
  5. cd to $CATALINA_HOME
    • vi bin/setenv.sh (will need to type this out the first time)
    • add this inside the vim and change the specific path 
      export JAVA_OPTS="-Dfile.encoding=UTF-8 -DGHIX_SECNTX_TYPE=db -Dorg.owasp.esapi.resources=/Users/leong_e/Documents/Workfolder/beta/ghix/ghix-setup/esapi -Dbitronix.tm.configuration=/Users/leong_e/Documents/Workfolder/beta/ghix/ghix-setup/conf/configuration.properties -DPASSWORD_KEY=ghix123 -Xms256m -Xmx2056m -XX:PermSize=1524m -XX:MaxPermSize=2556m"

export GHIX_HOME="/Users/leong_e/Documents/Workfolder/beta/ghix"
    • Hurry, get out of VIM! :wq!
  6. Put the file deploymentScript.sh in desired folder
  7. copy from where your ojdbc6-11.2.0.1.0.jar file lives to your lib. 
    cp /Users/leong_e/.m2/repository/com/oracle/ojdbc6/11.2.0.1.0/ojdbc6-11.2.0.1.0.jar $CATALINA_HOME/lib
    The space before $CATALINA_HOME is deliberate. And make sure to change the path to your own.
    • If the file is not there, go into /SHARED-PLATFORMS/ghix/ghix-platform/setup/dependencies
    • run ./install-maven-dep.sh
    • This will update the .m2 repository
    • run 
      cp /Users/seimithsuth/Documents/workfolder/SHARED-PLATFORMS/ghix/ghix-platform/setup/dependencies/ojdbc6-11.2.0.1.0.jar ~/.m2/repository/com/oracle/ojdbc6/11.2.0.1.0
  8. Check your context.xml in $CATALINA_HOME/conf/context.xml (Note: Depends on which project you're on. ie: phix, state...
  9. Change the source paths to your .profile
  10. Go into the folder you put your deploymentScript.sh file and run it: ./deploymentScript.sh
Next - Start Your Server: (2/3)

item.title: Typography
item.description:
PHIX 2015 Typography

The following Google Fonts are being used in the PHIX 2015 theme.

  • Roboto Slab

    We use Roboto Slab for header fonts.

  • Lato

    We use Lato for our body font.

  • FontAwesome 3.2.1

    We use FontAwesome for most of our icons.

item.title: Humans.md
item.description:
What's a humans.md file?

Find everything you need to know about the PHIX 2015 theme. There are steps on how to create sprites, what references were used to create the theme, how to build new LESS files and more.

The human.md file lives in ghix-web/src/main/webapp/resources/humans.md.

Learn how to:

  • Grunt SVG, PNG, images into Sprites
  • How to put the sprite into your HTML

Grunt.js Intro

Start with this to get Grunt running.
